utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Gentlemen, Star Wars Day is rapidly approaching. We should finalize our plans.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What? That’s a real thing? What is it, Star Wars Christmas?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No. Don’t be ridiculous. That’s Wookiee Life Day.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So, when is it?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, well, it’s not May the fifth, and it’s not May the third. It’s May the fourth.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Get it?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: May the fourth be with you?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: May the force be with you. Get it?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, no. This face wasn’t because I didn’t get it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Come in.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, you got a second?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. Actually, I’m glad you’re here. I’m working on the Star Wars Day schedule. Now, I have a window built in after Phantom Menace for complaining, but I’m worried an hour won’t be enough time.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, I’ve got some bad news.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What is it?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I just read online that Arthur Jeffries passed away.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Professor Proton is dead?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sorry, buddy.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Comforting you?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Your heart might be in the right place, but your head, chest and arms certainly aren’t.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Anyway, the, the funeral’s on Sunday.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: But, that’s Star Wars Day.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, um, of all the things about this that are sad, that might not be number one. You okay? I know he meant a lot to you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m fine.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay. Yet he cried when they changed the Raisin Bran box.

utterance.speaker: Professor Proton (on youtube)
utterance.content: This, uh, this is something interesting boys and girls. After an owl eats, he spits up part of his meal that he can’t digest, in the form of a pellet. Is, isn’t that a hoot? We’ll be right back after I fire my writers. Oh, shut up.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Watching your old friend?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hmm. Yes. Look at him, Amy. It’s such a shame. Struck down in the prime of my life.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Do you want me to go to the funeral with you?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, I’m not going to the funeral.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All those people blowing their noses. You can’t tell the sick from the sad. Mm. I’ll be at home celebrating Star Wars Day, as planned.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Are you sure you don’t want to go say good-bye?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Amy, mourning the inevitable is a complete waste of time.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: And watching a bunch of goofy space movies you’ve seen hundreds of times isn’t?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: If we were in a physical relationship, you just lost sex tonight.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, guys.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey, Penny. Happy Star Wars Day.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Can I make you breakfast? Admiral Ackbar’s Snack Bar is open for business.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, thanks. Leonard and I are just going to the funeral.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You sure. Not even coffee? We have R2-Decaf. Maybe a nice Cafe Au Leia?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: And if you’re not in the mood for coffee I can always make you a Chai Tea-3PO.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, I get it, like C3PO. What happened to me?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey, uh, Sheldon, you want anything?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Uh, no, thank you.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You’re being so quiet. Are you upset or are you just rebooting?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m fine.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sweetie, are you sure you don’t want to come with us to the funeral?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, I appreciate the offer, but Arthur is gone and there’s nothing I can do about it. When Darth Vader struck down Obi-Wan, did Luke cry like a baby and go to his funeral?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, he blew up the Death Star. Why do I know this?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Arthur Jeffries was a scientist. I’m sure he didn’t care about silly superstitions like funerals. You know, if he were here, I think he’d say enjoy Star Wars Day.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: He was 84, he’d say where’s my pudding?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Before you go, at least let me pack you some Attack of the Scones for the road.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, like Attack of the Clones. We are leaving right now.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Arthur passing away was harder on Sheldon than he’s ready to admit. Really hoping this will cheer him up.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Me, too. Although, it might’ve been thoughtless of us to bake a Death Star cake.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No, it combines two of Sheldon’s favorite things, chocolate chips and the ability to destroy a planet at the push of a button.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Well, anyway, it’ll be a nice surprise for the boys. And Howie doesn’t think I take his interests seriously, so hopefully this will keep him fooled for a while.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Okay, let’s get the fondant and start decorating.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: This is pretty cool. You don’t see too many spherical cakes.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I wonder why that is.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I have a confession to make.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hmm?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’ve never been to a funeral before.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I just never knew anyone that died. I had a pet pig when I was a kid. I mean, when he died, we didn’t have a funeral, we had a barbecue.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, we won’t be eating Arthur tonight.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I didn’t know him very well, but I still really liked him. It’s weird that he’s just gone.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I feel like I want to cry.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh that’s, that’s fine. Go ahead.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I can’t do it with you staring at me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, I’m dry. You’re a big crybaby, you start, I’ll join in.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I am not a crybaby.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Toy Story 3?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: The toys were holding hands in a furnace. Look, Arthur lived a full life. And he inspired a lot of people. Sure, he, he was my childhood hero, but the fact that I got to work with him, side by side, before he died was, it was, it was a gift.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It was a gift. Thank you for being the emotional one in this relationship.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I got your back.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay, here we go. Episode I: The Phantom Menace.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Ugh, let’s get this over with.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Since we all agree Episode I isn’t our favourite, maybe we just skip it this time.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Howard, I think you of all people should avoid espousing the principle that if something is not our favourite we should just get rid of it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You know, I heard of this way of watching the movies called the Machete Order, where you watch Episodes IV and V, then skip Episode I, watch II and III as a flashback, and then finish with VI.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, so you’d lose most of Jar Jar, all the trade route talk and the boring senate hearings, which are like watching C-SPAN with monsters.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Get rid of the trade route part? Then how would Palpatine get Chancellor Valorum kicked out of office? How would he get himself elected? How? Can we get through one holiday without you saying something ridiculous?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It was just a suggestion.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, you know what else was just a suggestion? Why don’t we change the Raisin Bran box? Hmm? And you know who got hurt by that? Every single person who eats breakfast.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Wow.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I think he’s taking this Professor Proton thing pretty hard.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Should we try to console him?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Or should we respect his privacy in this moment of grief?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: By staying here and watching the movie.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That’s what good friends would do.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, at least without Sheldon here, we got to start with Episode IV.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Mm, true. I do feel guilty about him.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Me, too.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Maybe we should see how he’s doing.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: But after the cantina scene.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Obviously.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Look at Arthur, cracking up at a joke I told him. I’ll never hear that laugh again.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: You never heard it that time.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Arthur. I thought you were dead.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: I am. Oh, it, it’s fantastic. I mean this, this is the longest that I’ve gone without running into a men’s room in, in, in years.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why are you here?

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: I don’t know. I was, I was hoping I was going to haunt my ex-wife.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I know why. You’ve come to me because you’re my Obi-Wan.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: I’m, I’m not, I’m not familiar with that. Is, is, is that an, an Internet?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wow. Uh, you’re dead, so I’m going to let that slide. Obi-Wan Kenobi is a character from Star Wars. After his physical demise, he comes to Luke Skywalker as his mentor in spirit form.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: Well, that, that clears that up.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You must be here to give me advice.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: Well, this, this is weird. Most, most of my robes open in, in the back.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Those are your Jedi robes.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: Oh, wait. What, what, what is, what is this?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Be careful with that.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: Oh. Oh. Oh, neato. I’m, uh, I’m going to need a Band-Aid.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So, what did you think of your first funeral?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, I don’t want to be a jerk, but it was kind of a bummer.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, well, when I die, you can rent a bounce house.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You think about dying?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Mm. Well, I think more about if I’d have any regrets.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What would you regret?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Mm, you know, that I didn’t travel more, take more risks, learn another language.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know Klingon.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s true.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, I meant that as a regret.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I just thought of one more.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What’s that?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I regret not saying yes when you asked me to marry you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, it just wasn’t the right time.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: And this is also not the right time. Do not propose.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I know that face. That’s your propose face.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I was not gonna propose. It’s already two to one.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What’s two to one?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I proposed twice, you proposed once. Two to one.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, my. It’s not a contest.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t know what you’re upset about. I’m the one who’s losing.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay. Fine. Would you feel better if I propose so you could turn me down again?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, I think I would.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay. Leonard, will you marry me?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hmm.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, don’t you dare. You reject me right now and tie things up.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s just such a big decision. I don’t want to have any regrets.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Did you ever watch Professor Proton when you were a kid?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: No. My dad controlled the TV, so unless someone was a Texas Ranger, Jake or the Fatman, we didn’t see it.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I never watched him, either, but he seems to be the reason that Sheldon got interested in science.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Not me. I got into science ’cause I was always the smallest kid in school, so I thought if I became a scientist, I could invent a formula that made me taller.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: That’s cute.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Yeah, I thought it was working for a while, but then I found out my brother was just lowering the pencil marks on the door frame. How about you?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, I guess it must have been back when I was in the Girl Sprouts.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Girl Sprouts?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: My mom made it up as an alternative to the Girl Scouts. She didn’t want me selling cookies on some street corner like a whore.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: How did that get you into science?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, I went to the library and took out a book on biology to see what whores did.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: On the one hand, if I say yes…

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: This isn’t funny anymore. Just say no so we’re done with this. Will you marry me or not?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Ooh, interesting. Did you just propose to me again?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Really? Because I just heard will you marry me? That’s two proposals, one day. Sounds like someone wants to spend the rest of her life telling people how to spell the name Hofstadter.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know what? Fine. Do whatever you want.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey. Penny, don’t get upset. Here. I love you, but, no, I will not marry you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Now, about that second proposal. On the one hand…

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: Where, where, where are we?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: This is the swampland of Dagobah. It’s where Luke was trained in the ways of the Jedi.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: Oh. Too bad. I thought it was Florida.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: When Obi-Wan came to Luke on this very spot, he gave him all sorts of helpful advice. So, um, what do you got for me?

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: Um, always, get, get a prenup.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s it? I thought there’d be more of a reason why you’re here.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: Well, why, why do you think I’m here?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I suppose it has something to do with your recent passing.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: Is, is this the, the first time you’ve lost, you know, someone close to you?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, no. No. I’ve already had to say good-bye to 11 Dr. Whos.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: Yeah, I’ve, I’ve outlived a few of my doctors, too.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Of course, my grandfather died when I was five. My father died when I was 14.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: I’m, I’m sorry about that.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And now you’re gone, too. It’s like all the men I’ve looked up to have gone away.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: Well, you know, it’s, it’s okay to, to be sad about them. Just, just make sure, you know, you appreciate those who, who are still there for you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: But I do appreciate them.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: Well, then, what am I doing in a swamp dressed like Friar Tuck? Appreciate them, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, buddy. Heard you’re having a rough day. You all right?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m okay. How was the funeral?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It was nice, you know. A lot of people showed up, told some great stories about him. Did you know that Arthur’s son is a high school sci…? Hey, the guys are about to start Jedi. You want to go watch?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I do. After I make them go back and watch one through five first.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, that, that’ll take us all night.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s true. Oh, it’s a good thing I had a nap.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Boy, some of the physical comedy with Jar Jar is a little tough to watch.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: At least they toned him down in the second one.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, he is pretty stupid.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey, we can say it. You can’t.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Hey, guys.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Happy Star Wars Day.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wow. A Death Star cake.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yeah. We were hoping it might cheer you up.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: And even though it meant we had to miss the movies, we could still be part of the fun.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, you didn’t miss anything. We just started over.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Son of a bitch.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re back.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: Yeah, apparently, um, I’m here whenever, when, whenever you need me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s nice.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: May, maybe for you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why do I need you now?

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: Well, as near as I could tell, you, you fell asleep watching Star Wars, and now you’re, you’re dreaming you’re watching Star Wars.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: I mean, don’t, don’t you see a problem there? I mean, how, how you’re spending your limited time on Earth?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Not at all.

utterance.speaker: Arthur
utterance.content: Okay, good luck to you.
